H1zTIQjDEF.content: Create a *nextion* device on *Serial1* with baud rate of *9600*.

ByxiEov4K.content: *t0.txt* specifies the text (*txt*) attribute of the object named *t0*. Object *t0* is the title displayed at the top of the screen.

BJ3fHjPNK.content: *t1.txt* specifies the text (*txt*) attribute of the object named *t1*. Object *t1* is the large text box occupying most of the display.

ryanLjOEK.content: String to be written to the *t1* text box.

ryQVBxK4Y.content: # A tutorial on using the nextion library can be found here: https://www.hackster.io/wayland2/use-nextion-displays-with-xod-4a99f2

@/example02-read-write-strings.description: Patch demonstrating how to read/write text attributes of nextion widgets and variables. To be used with the following Nextion GUI: https://github.com/WaylandM/xod-nextion/blob/master/hmi/xod-example02-read-write-strings.HMI

Hyt3VRO4F.content: Create a *nextion* device on *Serial1* with baud rate of *9600*.

SJn64Au4F.content: The *listen* node monitors page changes and stores current and previous page IDs.

B1Dvr0dVF.content: Write *current* and *previous* page IDs to their corresponding number boxes on Nextion display.

rks8Hlt4K.content: # A tutorial on using the nextion library can be found here: https://www.hackster.io/wayland2/use-nextion-displays-with-xod-4a99f2

@/example05-page-id.description: Patch to demonstrate reading numerical IDs of current and previous pages of the Nextion display. To be used with the following Nextion GUI: https://github.com/WaylandM/xod-nextion/blob/master/hmi/xod-example05-page-id.HMI

H1xe-N_VY.content: Create a *nextion* device on *Serial1* with baud rate of *9600*.

ByhYehdNY.content: In the Nextion GUI, we have configured button presses to generate triggers which can be detected by the *listen* node. The *listen* node must be updated continuously to monitor serial traffic for triggers.

Sk1o-ndEY.content: Each button on the Nextion GUI has been assigned its own unique trigger ID. When a button is pressed and released, its trigger ID will be detected and reported by the *listen* node.

SyOjz2uVY.content: We write the trigger ID to the number box on the Nextion display to show which button has been pressed.

BkPHBlFNt.content: # A tutorial on using the nextion library can be found here: https://www.hackster.io/wayland2/use-nextion-displays-with-xod-4a99f2

@/example04-touch-event.description: Patch to demonstrate detection of touch events. To be used with the following Nextion GUI: https://github.com/WaylandM/xod-nextion/blob/master/hmi/xod-example04-touch-event.HMI

HyzrKIivVY.content: Create a *nextion* device on *Serial1* with baud rate of *9600*.

BJFdcjOEY.content:
Dual state buttons can take one of two values: 
* **0** off state
* **1** on state

Here we read the state of the button and translate it to an LED luminance:
* **0** LED not illuminated
* **1** LED at maximum brightness

BysEBltEt.content: # A tutorial on using the nextion library can be found here: https://www.hackster.io/wayland2/use-nextion-displays-with-xod-4a99f2

@/example03-dual-state-button.description: Patch to demonstrate operation of dual-state buttons. To be used with the following Nextion GUI: https://github.com/WaylandM/xod-nextion/blob/master/hmi/xod-example03-dual-state-button.HMI

H1ftjTJFVK.content: Create a *nextion* device on *Serial1* with baud rate of *9600*.

B15WMxFNt.content: The *send-command* node can send any command in the Nextion instruction set (https://nextion.tech/instruction-set/). Here we send the command "sleep=1" to put the touchscreen to sleep.

HkUdBltVY.content: # A tutorial on using the nextion library can be found here: https://www.hackster.io/wayland2/use-nextion-displays-with-xod-4a99f2

rJInLgt4K.content: Update *n0* number box on Nextion screen to show countdown.

@/example06-send-command.description: Patch to demonstrate how commands can be sent to the Nextion display. To be used with the following Nextion GUI: https://github.com/WaylandM/xod-nextion/blob/master/hmi/xod-example06-send-command.HMI

@/get-page-id.description: Get ID number of current and previous pages.

BkkIl8PEt.content: # A tutorial on using the nextion library can be found here: https://www.hackster.io/wayland2/use-nextion-displays-with-xod-4a99f2

rJEKELvEK.content: Create a *nextion* device on *Serial1* with baud rate of *9600*.

rkjXBUwNF.content: Convert output from analog-read to a voltage (mV).

HkTyILDNK.content: Write voltage measurement to the value (*val*) attribute of the variable named *va0*.

BkMyP8vVK.content: *va0.val* specifies the value attribute of the object named *va0*.

H1HDPIvEF.content: *h0.val* specifies the value attribute of the object named *h0*. In this case, *h0* is a slider.

SJzJuLPNt.content: Read the value of the slider widget *h0*.

B1rVuIP4K.content: # Write a number to a nextion variable.

SJG8dID4Y.content: # Read a numeric value from a nextion slider widget.

HJo2dIwVt.content: Map slider value (0-100) to input range of servo (0-1).

SkNxFLvVY.content: Write transformed slider value to servo.

@/example01-read-write-numbers.description: Patch demonstrating how to read/write numeric attributes of nextion widgets and variables. To be used with the following Nextion GUI: https://github.com/WaylandM/xod-nextion/blob/master/hmi/xod-example01-read-write-numbers.HMI

@/nextion-serial.description: Create a nextion device on Serial.

@/nextion-serial2.description: Create a nextion device on Serial2.

HyogdgFVt.content: Check which page is active, so that we read/write from the correct objects.

@/example07-full-demo.description: Patch combining much of the functionality of the other examples for demonstration and testing purposes. To be used with the following Nextion GUI: https://github.com/WaylandM/xod-nextion/blob/master/hmi/xod-example07.HMI

@/nextion-serial3.description: Create a nextion device on Serial3.

BkTwWq5nU.description: Command. Specify object and attibute to be read. For example va0.val will read the value attribute of the object named va0.
BkTwWq5nU.label: CMD

HJG5Qu1VY.description: Pulse on each attempt to read a numeric value.
HJG5Qu1VY.label: Done

Bk1ksZxUY.description: Pulse on successful read of a numeric value.
Bk1ksZxUY.label: Read

@/read-number.description: Read a numeric attribute of an object on the nextion display.

@/send-command.description: Send any command in the Nextion instruction set to the touchscreen. https://nextion.tech/instruction-set/

ryxTPHx2U.description: Command. Specify object and attribute to be written. For example, va0.val will overwrite the value attribute of the object named va0.
ryxTPHx2U.label: CMD

@/write-number.description: Write to a numeric attribute of an object.

@/listen.description: Listen for nextion touch events and page changes. This node must be updated continuously.

Sk4kaPkVK.description: Command. Specify object and attibute to be read. For example, t0.txt will read the text attribute of the object named t0.
Sk4kaPkVK.label: CMD

@/read-string.description: Read a text attribute of an object on the nextion display.

Skm-t6Y53U.description: Command. Specify object and attribute to be written. For example, t0.txt will overwrite the text attribute of the object named t0.
Skm-t6Y53U.label: CMD

@/write-string.description: Write to the string attribute of an object.

description: Library for Nextion displays. Wraps Athanasios Seitanis's Easy Nextion Library (https://github.com/Seithan/EasyNextionLibrary).
name: nextion
